properties.areaDesc: Mahoning; Ashtabula Lakeshore; Ashtabula Inland; Crawford; Northern Erie; Lake; Geauga; Southern Erie; Trumbull
properties.headline: Flood Watch issued November 1 at 3:44AM EDT expiring November 2 at 12:00PM EDT by NWS Cleveland OH
properties.description:
Rain will fill in this morning and increase in intensity today as
low pressure tracks from the Mid-Mississippi Valley this morning
to Northeast Ohio by this evening. Additional rainfall of 1.5 to 2
inches of rain is expected through tonight with locally higher
amounts possible. The axis of heaviest forecast rainfall continues
to shift westward and the watch has been expanded to include Huron
and Erie Counties in Ohio. This rain will lead to river rises and
flooding of low lying and poor drainage areas.
The Flood Watch continues for

* Portions of northeast Ohio and northwest Pennsylvania,
including the following areas, in northeast Ohio, Ashtabula
Inland, Ashtabula Lakeshore, Geauga, Lake, Mahoning, and
Trumbull. In northwest Pennsylvania, Crawford, Northern Erie,
and Southern Erie.

* From noon EDT today through Friday morning

* Additional rainfall of 1.5 to 2 inches with locally higher
amounts are likely.

* Rises on rivers, creeks, and streams are expected and may lead
to flooding. Flooding is likely in other low lying and flood
prone areas.
properties.instruction:
A Flood Watch is issued when there is a potential for flooding.
Monitor the forecast and remain alert for possible flood
warnings. Those in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to
take action should a flood warning be issued or if flooding
develops.

NWSheadline: FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON EDT TODAY THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING

title: Current watches, warnings, and advisories for Pennsylvania
